instead of the current `ns408/homebrew-libnspv`

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Can't post a screenshot but I'm pretty sure I got nSPV KMD going on my raspberry pi 4. üòÑ

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: wasn't sure what to put for p2p though <https://docs.komodoplatform.com/nSPV/#enabling-the-nspv-client>

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: What exactly does `misbehave` score mean when looking at peers? and is there a point where it disconnects from them or something?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Regnar full nodes have a system of keeping score of which nodes should be banned, and each peer gets a "banscore", so misbehaving most likely means close to being banned

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sending invalid/wrong data will get you banned as a peer, since that is an attack vector

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and it can happen normally, i.e. during a chain re-org, where different nodes have different views of reality

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Okay I thought it was normal for some peers to disagree at chain tips, I have a few peers with misbehave score of 2. What's the scale here for "not normal"?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I don't know and would have to go read source code to find out. If it's not causing bugs, I wouldn't worry about it

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: @Regnar `p2p` should be set in coins file, and match what is seen from `getinfo` p2pport for the chain.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is automatic for coins already properly configured in the coins file

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you just need to know the coin symbol

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no symbol defaults to KMD

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: @Regnar  That was something I added, because for a while there were lots of non updated full nodes sending rubbish or incorrect heights

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It only really uses it to ban a node on old version, or if it continues to send chain tips shorter than 2 blocks behind the current tip it has.

Author: ns408#8889
Content:
*To install libnspv on mac*

```
brew tap jl777/libnspv
brew install libnspv
```

To run it on port 3000
```
nspv KMD -p 3000
```
